subject: SDS
title: Prejudice and Discrimination
description: This course takes an interdisciplinary approach in examining causes of, impacts of, and ways to overcome stereotyping, prejudice, and discrimination. The experience and behaviour of both the target and the purveyor of discrimination will be studied from individual, interpersonal, and structural perspectives. Topics may include overt and subtle forms of prejudice, intersectionality, and situational barriers to stigmatized groups' success. [Note: Formerly PSYCH 449R]
